    Class: Epoch.Chart.Base

    Defined in: coffee/epoch.coffee
    Inherits: Epoch.Events

    Overview

    The base class for all charts in Epoch. Defines chart dimensions, keeps a reference of the chart's containing elements. And defines core method for handling data and drawing.

    Direct Known Subclasses

    Epoch.Chart.SVG, Epoch.Chart.Canvas

    Instance Method Summary

    • - (void) constructor(options) Constructor Creates a new base chart.
    • - (void) setData(data) Set the initial data for the chart.
    • - (void) update(data, draw = true) Updates the chart with new data.
    • - (void) draw() Abstract Draws the chart.
    • - (Array) extent(cmp) Calculates an extent throughout the layers based on the given comparator.

    Inherited Method Summary

    Methods inherited from Epoch.Events

    #constructor, #on, #off, #trigger

    Constructor Details

    - (void) constructor(options)

    Creates a new base chart.

    Parameters:

    • options (Object) — Options to set for this chart.

    Options Hash: (option):

    • width (Integer) — Sets an explicit width for the visualization (optional).
    • height (Integer) — Sets an explicit height for the visualization (optional).

    Instance Method Details

    - (void) setData(data)

    Set the initial data for the chart. @param data Data to initially set for the given chart. The data format can vary from chart to chart. The base class assumes that the data provided will be an array of layers.

    - (void) update(data, draw = true)

    Updates the chart with new data. @param data Data to replace the current data for the chart.

    Parameters:

    • draw (Boolean) — Whether or not to redraw the chart after the data has been set. Default: true.

    - (void) draw()

    This method is abstract. Must be overriden in child classes to perform chart specific drawing.

    Draws the chart.

    - (Array) extent(cmp)

    Calculates an extent throughout the layers based on the given comparator.

    Parameters:

    • cmp (Function) — Comparator to use for performing the min and max for the extent calculation.

    Returns:

    • (Array) — an extent array with the first element as the minimum value in the chart's data set and the second element as the maximum.
